meanings.definition: A vector that remains unchanged in direction when a linear transformation is applied to it.
meanings.sent1: The eigenvector pointed in the same direction even after the transformation.
meanings.sent2: The eigenvector of the matrix stayed pointing in its original way.
meanings.sent3: The eigenvector decided to stay put and not change its direction.
meanings.sent4: Like a compass needle, the eigenvector steadfastly held its course.
meanings.sent5: The eigenvector was like a loyal arrow, never wavering from its path.

meanings.definition: A vector that is associated with a square matrix and satisfies a certain equation.
meanings.sent1: The square matrix had an eigenvector that met the equation perfectly.
meanings.sent2: The eigenvector of the matrix fit the equation just right.
meanings.sent3: The eigenvector and the matrix equation were a match made in math heaven.
meanings.sent4: The eigenvector danced elegantly to the tune of the matrix equation.
meanings.sent5: The eigenvector and the matrix equation were like puzzle pieces that clicked together seamlessly.
